member.name: M:Json.NETMF.DateTimeExtensions.FromIso8601(System.String)
member.summary: Converts an ISO 8601 time/date format string, which is used by JSON and others, into a DateTime object.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.DateTimeExtensions.ToIso8601(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts a DateTime object into an ISO 8601 string. This version always returns the string in UTC format.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.DateTimeExtensions.TwoDigits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures a two-digit number with leading zero if necessary.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.DateTimeExtensions.ThreeDigits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures a three-digit number with leading zeros if necessary.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.DateTimeExtensions.ToASPNetAjax(System.DateTime)
member.summary: The ASP.NET Ajax team made up their own time date format for JSON strings, and it's explained in this article: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb299886.aspx Converts a DateTime to the ASP.NET Ajax JSON format.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.DateTimeExtensions.FromASPNetAjax(System.String)
member.summary: Converts an ASP.NET Ajax JSON string to DateTime

member.name: T:Json.NETMF.JsonParser
member.summary: Parses JSON strings into a Hashtable. The Hashtable contains one or more key/value pairs (DictionaryEntry objects). Each key is the name of a property that (hopefully) exists in the class object that it represents. Each value is one of the following: Hastable - Another list of one or more DictionaryEntry objects, essentially representing a property that is another class. ArrayList - An array of one or more objects, which themselves can be one of the items enumerated in this list. Value Type - an actual value, such as a string, int, bool, Guid, DateTime, etc

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonParser.JsonDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, long, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonParser.JsonDecode(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value; and fills 'success' with the successfullness of the parse.
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, a long, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonParser.ParseNumber(System.Char[],System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines the type of number (int, double, etc) and returns an object containing that value.

member.name: T:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer
member.summary: JSON.NetMF - JSON Serialization and Deserialization library for .NET Micro Framework

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Convert an object to a JSON string.
member.param: The value to convert. Supported types are: Boolean, String, Byte, (U)Int16, (U)Int32, Float, Double, Decimal, Array, IDictionary, IEnumerable, Guid, Datetime, DictionaryEntry, Object and null.
member.returns: The JSON object as a string or null when the value type is not supported.
member.remarks: For objects, only public properties with getters are converted.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Desrializes a Json string into an object.
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, a long, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.DeserializeString(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes a Json string into an object.
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, a long, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.SerializeObject(System.Object,Json.NETMF.DateTimeFormat)
member.summary: Convert an object to a JSON string.
member.param: The value to convert. Supported types are: Boolean, String, Byte, (U)Int16, (U)Int32, Float, Double, Decimal, Array, IDictionary, IEnumerable, Guid, Datetime, DictionaryEntry, Object and null.
member.returns: The JSON object as a string or null when the value type is not supported.
member.remarks: For objects, only public properties with getters are converted.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.SerializeIEnumerable(System.Collections.IEnumerable,Json.NETMF.DateTimeFormat)
member.summary: Convert an IEnumerable to a JSON string.
member.returns: The JSON object as a string or null when the value type is not supported.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.SerializeIDictionary(System.Collections.IDictionary,Json.NETMF.DateTimeFormat)
member.summary: Convert an IDictionary to a JSON string.
member.returns: The JSON object as a string or null when the value type is not supported.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.SerializeString(System.String)
member.summary: Safely serialize a String into a JSON string value, escaping all backslash and quote characters.

member.name: P:Json.NETMF.JsonSerializer.DateFormat
member.summary: Gets/Sets the format that will be used to display and parse dates in the Json data.

member.name: T:Json.NETMF.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Enumeration of the popular formats of time and date within Json. It's not a standard, so you have to know which on you're using.

member.name: M:Json.NETMF.CharExtensions.ConvertFromUtf32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a Unicode character to a string of its ASCII equivalent. Very simple, it works only on ordinary characters.
